title: Reverse String
description:
Write a function that reverses a string. The input string is given as a list of characters s.

You must do this by modifying the input list in-place with O(1) extra memory.

Return the reversed list.

Example 1:
  Input: s = ["h","e","l","l","o"]
  Output: ["o","l","l","e","h"]

Example 2:
  Input: s = ["H","a","n","n","a","h"]
  Output: ["h","a","n","n","a","H"]
check_function:
def check(candidate):
    assert candidate(["h","e","l","l","o"]) == ["o","l","l","e","h"]
    assert candidate(["H","a","n","n","a","h"]) == ["h","a","n","n","a","H"]
    assert candidate(["a"]) == ["a"]
    assert candidate(["a","b"]) == ["b","a"]
    assert candidate([]) == []
    assert candidate(["x","y","z"]) == ["z","y","x"]
    assert candidate(["1","2","3","4","5"]) == ["5","4","3","2","1"]
